page.title: 07MAIN ROADS AND IMPROVEMENTS.
page.content: The present{A55 Trunk Road}runs in a natural gap through the Clwydian Hills and passes directly through Rhuallt village.{It is the main,landward,route {between Chester,to the east,and Bangor {to the west. It is now intended that the A55 be high standard dual-carriageway between these two centres.Various works have been completed,or are in the process of completion in relation to this scheme. The other main route is the coastal A548.It is hoped that the improvements made to the A55 will divert most of the heavy traffic on to this route and avoid bottlenecks at seaside resorts, so speeding traffic flow and improving access to the west.
